derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 17th cent.: from Latin coeliacus, from Greek koiliakos, from koilia 'belly'

means.word_mean: 1. of or in or belonging to the cavity of the abdomen

auth_sentence.content: It's important to consult your GP if you suspect coeliac disease.
auth_sentence.res_content: It's important to consult your GP if you suspect coeliac disease.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It's important to consult your GP if you suspect coeliac disease.

auth_sentence.content: Coeliac disease is a delayed immune reaction to the gluten part of wheat.
auth_sentence.res_content: Coeliac disease is a delayed immune reaction to the gluten part of wheat.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Coeliac disease is a delayed immune reaction to the gluten part of wheat.

auth_sentence.content: Organisations such as Coeliac UK also provide a wealth of information on which foods are gluten-free.
